intro: Adenocheton phyllanthoides, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional herbal medicine for various ailments.
